label: AL rdfs:label@en
definition: AL IAO:0000115@en
example of usage: AL IAO:0000112@en
editor note: AL IAO:0000116@en SPLIT=|

label: vibrational spectrometer configuration specification
definition: A setting datum that specifies the needed settings of a spectrometer used in vibrational spectroscopy.

label: Raman spectrometer configuration
definition: A device setting that represents the measured or set physical qualities which make up the configuration state of a Raman spectrometer at the time of a measurement (e.g. operating temperature, exitation wavelength, groove density, ...).
example of usage: The set of meassured configuration characteristics of a Raman spectrometer, like the operating temperature of a Raman spectrometer.

label: integration time setting
definition: A setting datum that specifies the length of time that a photo detector is allowed to collect photons before passing the accumulated charge to the A/D converter for processing. The minimum integration time is the shortest integration time the device supports and is dependent on how fast the detector can read out all of the pixel information. Integration time should not be confused with data transfer speed.
editor note: This class should better be defined in a more general device ontology or a domain ontology with the scope of optical devices.

label: preamplifier gain setting
definition: A setting datum that specifies the preamplifier gain in CCD sensors.
editor note: This class should better be defined in a more general device ontology.

label: horizontal shift speed setting
definition: A setting datum that specifies the horizontal shift speed in CCD sensors.
editor note: This class should better be defined in a more general device ontology or a domain ontology with the scope of optical devices.

label: vertical shift speed setting
definition: A setting datum that specifies the vertical shift speed in CCD sensors.
editor note: This class should better be defined in a more general device ontology or a domain ontology with the scope of optical devices.

label: device temperature setting
definition: A setting datum that specifies the operating temperature of a device.
editor note: This class should better be defined in a more general device ontology.

label: number of accumulations
definition: A setting datum that specifies the desired number of measurements a spectrometer has to perform on the same location, without position change to produce an usable spectrum. This setting datum is relevant to improve the signal to noise ratio.
editor note: This class might better be defined in a more general device ontology.

label: CCD sensor binning read mode setting
definition: A setting datum that specifies the binning read mode of a device with a CCD sensor.
editor note: This class should better be defined in a more general device ontology or a domain ontology with the scope of optical devices.

label: groove density
definition: A physical quality inhering in a diffraction grating device by virtue of the device's function to diffract light. This quality specifically depends on the number of grooves per area of the grating device and is usually expressed in grooves per millimeter.
editor note: temp class until NTR in PATO has been accepted and merged (https://github.com/pato-ontology/pato/issues/541)

label: groove density setting
definition: A setting datum that specifies the number of grooves in a diffraction grating device.
editor note: This class should better be defined in a more general device ontology or a domain ontology with the scope of optical devices.

label: diffraction grating
definition: A device that is an optical component with a periodic structure that diffracts light into several beams travelling in different directions (i.e. different diffraction angles)
editor note: This class should better be defined in a more general device ontology or a domain ontology with the scope of optical devices.

label: deprecated_excitation wavelength
definition: A physical quality of the light source that is used used to excite a system to a higher energy state.
editor note: This class is not needed, as PATO:wavelength is sufficient, if this quality of a Raman device is really needed.

label: excitation wavelength setting
definition: A setting datum that specifies the wavelength of an electromagnetic radiation source (e.g. a laser) which has the function to excite the energy state of a target material.
editor note: This class should better be defined in a more general device ontology or a domain ontology with the scope of optical devices.

label: objective magnification factor setting
definition: A setting datum that specifies the magnification factor of the objective collecting the scattered light.

label: spectral window range maximum
definition: A data item that is the part of a Raman spectrum which represents the maximum wavenumber included in the spectrum and which is calculated from the windows size and window center.
editor note: It needs to be determined, if this is also part of another kind of spectrum, such as a vibrational spectrum in general. We also need to decide, if we need to also model the terms window size and window center, from which this term is derived.

label: spectral window range minimum
definition: A data item that is the part of a Raman spectrum which represents the minimum wavenumber included in the spectrum and which is calculated from the windows size and window center.
editor note: It needs to be determined, if this is also part of another kind of spectrum, such as a vibrational spectrum in general. We also need to decide, if we need to also model the terms window size and window center, from which this term is derived.

label: incident light power datum
alternative term: excitation light power|light power on the sample
definition: A scalar measurement datum that is the result of measuring the incoming light power before the sample holder and which depends on the laser power and on the dispersive behaviour of the filters and optical components.
comment: The incident power is an elementary measurement parameter allowing to compare among measurements conducted with the same setup. A thorough investigation of the effects of light irradiation onto the sample depends on the local irradiance (power per unit area) and requires deeper knowledge of the irradiation geometry, e.g. width, depth and shape of the focal spot.
example of usage: 200 mW

label: region of interest
definition: A site that refers to a user-defined portion of the image area in which data will be acquired. The remainder of the image area will be discarded.
editor note: See also https://w3id.org/reproduceme#ROI & http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/NCIT_C85402

label: region of interest width
definition: A setting datum that specifies the width (length in the X direction) of the region of interest.
comment: region of interest width = (point distance X) * (number of measurements X)
example of usage: 1 mm

label: region of interest breadth
definition: A setting datum that specifies the height (length in the Y direction) of the region of interest.
comment: region of interest breadth = (point distance Y) * (number of measurements Y)
example of usage: 0.5 mm

label: region of interest depth
definition: A setting datum that specifies the depth (length in the Z direction) of the region of interest.
comment: region of interest depth = (point distance Z) * (number of measurements Z)
example of usage: 0.1 mm

label: point distance X
alternative term: sampling pace in the X direction|sampling step in the X direction|voxel distance in the X direction
definition: A setting datum that specifies the equal distance which the incident light beam will be moved laterally in the X direction on a given sample within the region of interest after each measurement, when performing a spatially resolved spectroscopy.
comment: point distance X = (region of interest width) / (number of measurements X)
example of usage: 20 µm

label: point distance Y
alternative term: sampling pace in the Y direction|sampling step in the Y direction|voxel distance in the Y direction
definition: A setting datum that specifies the equal distance which the incident light beam will be moved laterally in the Y direction on a given sample within the region of interest after each measurement, when performing a spatially resolved spectroscopy.
comment: point distance Y = (region of interest breadth) / (number of measurements Y)
example of usage: 10 µm

label: point distance Z
alternative term: sampling pace in the Z direction|sampling step in the Z direction|voxel distance in the Z direction|vertical mapping distance|axial mapping distance
definition: A setting datum that specifies the equal distance which the incident light beam will moved along the focal axis within the region of interest, when performing a spatially resolved spectroscopy.
comment: point distance Z = (region of interest depth) / (number of measurements Z)
example of usage: 10 µm

label: number of measurements X
alternative term: number of points in the X direction|number of points per line
definition: A setting datum that specifies how many equally configured measurements of a sample are to be performed along the X-axis of a certain region of interest. Together with the point distance X, this setting defines the region of interest width.
comment: number of measurements X = (region of interest width) / (point distance X)

label: number of measurements Y
alternative term: number of points in the Y direction|number of lines per layer
definition: A setting datum that specifies how many equally configured measurements of a sample are to be performed along the Y-axis of a certain region of interest. Together with the point distance Y, this setting defines the region of interest breadth.
comment: number of measurements = (region of interest breadth) / (point distance Y)

label: number of measurements Z
alternative term: number of points in the Z direction|number of layers per acquisition
definition: A setting datum that specifies how many equally configured measurements of a sample are to be performed in the vertical direction (on the Z-axis) of a certain region of interest. Together with the focal point distance, this setting defines the region of interest depth.
comment: number of measurements Z = (region of interest depth) / (point distance Z)

label: near-infrared exitation wavelength setting datum
definition: An exitation wavelength setting datum that is within the range of near-infrared light (0.8–2 μm).

label: ultraviolet exitation wavelength setting datum
definition: An exitation wavelength setting datum that is within the range of ultraviolet light. This setting datum is used in VIBSO to differentiate Raman spectroscopies based on excitation wavelength.

label: primary Raman data
super class: 'data item'|(is_specified_output_of some ('data transformation' and (has_specified_input some 'Raman raw data')))
definition: A data item that is obtained by processing raw Raman data.

label: Raman scattering assay objective
definition: An assay objective to detect the Raman scattering of a sample (the evaluated material entity).
equivalent class axiom: 'assay objective' and ('is about' some ('data item' and ('is about' some ('material entity'         and ('participates in' some 'Raman scattering') and ('has role' some 'evaluant role'))) and (is_specified_output_of some assay)))

label: resolution
definition: A physical quality of a measurement device that expresses (realizes) the device's capacity to distinguish between two distinct but closely related measurements of the same physical quality or type, often quantified as the smallest detectable difference (resolution interval) between measured values.
example of usage: This class is actually to general for VIBSO's scope. It needs to be discussed with CHMO and OBI devs which of these is a better home, as there currently does not exist an optical device ontology within OBO Foundry. OBI contains most terms around optical devices so far.

label: resolution interval
super class: data item|'is about' some resolution|'has value specification' some 'value specification'
definition: A data item that quantifies a resolution, by representing the minimum measurable difference between two measurements of the same physical quality or type, such that the measurements can be distinguished as different.
example of usage: This class is actually to general for VIBSO's scope. It needs to be discussed with CHMO and OBI devs which of these is a better home, as there currently does not exist an optical device ontology within OBO Foundry. OBI contains most terms around optical devices so far.

label: resolution power
definition: A ratio that quantifies the ability of a measurement device to distinguish between small differences in measurement values, expressed as the ratio between a typical measurement datum and the corresponding resolution interval.
example of usage: This class is actually to general for VIBSO's scope. It needs to be discussed with CHMO and OBI devs which of these is a better home, as there currently does not exist an optical device ontology within OBO Foundry. OBI contains most terms around optical devices so far.

label: spatial resolution interval
definition: A resolution interval that quantifies the minimum distance between two points such that they can be considered two separate points in a given microscope under specific experimental parameters.
example of usage: This class is actually to general for VIBSO's scope. It needs to be discussed with CHMO and OBI devs which of these is a better home, as there currently does not exist an optical device ontology within OBO Foundry. OBI contains most terms around optical devices so far.

label: lateral resolution interval as angle
definition: A spatial resolution interval that quantifies the minimum angular separation between two points on a plane orthogonal to the light ray, expressed as an angle centered in the lens (Formula: δθ = 1.22 * λ / D).
example of usage: This class is actually to general for VIBSO's scope. It needs to be discussed with CHMO and OBI devs which of these is a better home, as there currently does not exist an optical device ontology within OBO Foundry. OBI contains most terms around optical devices so far.

label: lateral resolution interval as length
definition: A spatial resolution interval that quantifies the minimum linear separation between two points on a plane orthogonal to the light ray, expressed as the distance from the center of the optical spot (Formula: δr = 0.61 * λ / NA).
equivalent class axiom: $δr = 0.61\cdotλ/NA$ (Abbe formula, derived from the Rayleigh criterion with the Kirchhoff, Debye and paraxial approximation) $= 1.22 λ\cdot(f/\sharp)$
example of usage: This class is actually to general for VIBSO's scope. It needs to be discussed with CHMO and OBI devs which of these is a better home, as there currently does not exist an optical device ontology within OBO Foundry. OBI contains most terms around optical devices so far.

label: axial resolution interval as length
definition: A spatial resolution interval that quantifies the minimum measurable separation between two points along the axis of propagation of the light ray, expressed as a linear distance (Formula: δz = 2 ⋅ n ⋅ λ / NA²).
example of usage: This class is actually to general for VIBSO's scope. It needs to be discussed with CHMO and OBI devs which of these is a better home, as there currently does not exist an optical device ontology within OBO Foundry. OBI contains most terms around optical devices so far.

label: spectral resolution interval
definition: A resolution interval that quantifies the minimum separation between two narrow peaks in a spectrum such that they can be distinguished as two separate peaks.
example of usage: This class is actually to general for VIBSO's scope. It needs to be discussed with CHMO and OBI devs which of these is a better home, as there currently does not exist an optical device ontology within OBO Foundry. OBI contains most terms around optical devices so far.

label: spectral resolution interval as wavelength
definition: A spectral resolution interval that quantifies the minimum separation between two wavelengths such that they can be distinguished as different (Formula: δλ = λ / (n * N)).
equivalent class axiom: $δλ = λ / (n\cdot N) = RF\cdot Δλ\cdot WS / n$
example of usage: This class is actually to general for VIBSO's scope. It needs to be discussed with CHMO and OBI devs which of these is a better home, as there currently does not exist an optical device ontology within OBO Foundry. OBI contains most terms around optical devices so far.

label: spectral resolution interval as wavenumber
definition: A spectral resolution interval that quantifies the minimum separation between two wavenumbers such that they can be distinguished as different (Formula: δν~ = δλ / λ²).
example of usage: This class is actually to general for VIBSO's scope. It needs to be discussed with CHMO and OBI devs which of these is a better home, as there currently does not exist an optical device ontology within OBO Foundry. OBI contains most terms around optical devices so far.

label: spectral resolution interval as frequency
definition: A spectral resolution interval that quantifies the minimum separation between two frequencies such that they can be distinguished as different (Formula: δν = c * δν~ = c * δλ / λ²).
example of usage: This class is actually to general for VIBSO's scope. It needs to be discussed with CHMO and OBI devs which of these is a better home, as there currently does not exist an optical device ontology within OBO Foundry. OBI contains most terms around optical devices so far.

label: spectral resolution interval as energy
definition: A spectral resolution interval that quantifies the minimum separation between two energy levels such that they can be distinguished as different (Formula: δE = h * δν = h * c * δν~ = h * c * δλ / λ²).
example of usage: This class is actually to general for VIBSO's scope. It needs to be discussed with CHMO and OBI devs which of these is a better home, as there currently does not exist an optical device ontology within OBO Foundry. OBI contains most terms around optical devices so far.

label: radiometric resolution interval
definition: A resolution interval that quantifies the minimum difference in irradiated energy, often coded as gray level in a grayscale or look-up-table (LUT).
example of usage: This class is actually to general for VIBSO's scope. It needs to be discussed with CHMO and OBI devs which of these is a better home, as there currently does not exist an optical device ontology within OBO Foundry. OBI contains most terms around optical devices so far.

label: temporal resolution interval
definition: A resolution interval that quantifies the temporal separation between two measurements or frames, often expressed as the inverse of the frame rate. In techniques where temporal resolution is not directly derived from frame rate, it quantifies the minimum temporal interval between two resolvable events.
equivalent class axiom: In techniques where the temporal resolution is not given directly from a temporal distance between subsequent measurements (e.g., pulsed time resolved pump-probe techniques), it can be used more properly as defined above
example of usage: This class is actually to general for VIBSO's scope. It needs to be discussed with CHMO and OBI devs which of these is a better home, as there currently does not exist an optical device ontology within OBO Foundry. OBI contains most terms around optical devices so far.

label: diffraction limit
definition: A spatial resolution interval that quantifies the theoretical maximum spatial resolution achievable by an optical system, constrained by the diffraction of light.
equivalent class axiom: The Abbe diffraction limit, is defined as λ/ (2 NA) in which λ is the wavelength of the illuminating light and NA is the numerical aperture.
example of usage: This class is actually to general for VIBSO's scope. It needs to be discussed with CHMO and OBI devs which of these is a better home, as there currently does not exist an optical device ontology within OBO Foundry. OBI contains most terms around optical devices so far.

label: Stokes Raman scattering assay objective
definition: A Raman scattering assay objective to detect and analyse only Stokes Raman scattering.
equivalent class axiom: 'Raman scattering assay objective' and ('is about' some ('data item' and ('is about' some ('material entity'         and ('participates in' some 'Stokes Raman scattering') and ('has role' some 'evaluant role'))) and (is_specified_o5tput_of some assay)))

label: anti-Stokes Raman scattering assay objective
definition: A Raman scattering assay objective to detect and analyse only anti-Stokes Raman scattering.
equivalent class axiom: 'Raman scattering assay objective' and ('is about' some ('data item' and ('is about' some ('material entity'         and ('participates in' some 'anti-Stokes Raman scattering') and ('has role' some 'evaluant role'))) and (is_specified_o5tput_of some assay)))

label: vibrational mode assay objective
definition: An assay objective to probe the vibrational degrees of freedom of a molecule or material.

label: rotational mode assay objective
definition: An assay objective to probe the rotational degrees of freedom of a molecule.

label: substrate surface setting datum
definition: A setting datum that specifies the properties of the substrate surface of a spectroscope onto which the sample is absorbed, such as its material composition, nanostructure, surface roughness, and any surface modifications or coatings.

label: scanning probe tip setting datum
definition: A setting datum that specifies the properties and parameters of a scanning probe tip used in spectroscopy, such as such as its material composition, shape, size, tip-sample distance.

label: observation field setting datum
definition: A setting datum that specifies the observation field configuration of an optical system.
editor note: This class should better be defined in a more general device ontology or a domain ontology with the scope of optical devices.

label: confocal setting datum
definition: An observation field setting datum that specifies the confocal configuration of an optical system.
editor note: This class should better be defined in a more general device ontology or a domain ontology with the scope of optical devices.

label: widefield setting datum
definition: An observation field setting datum that specifies the widefield configuration of an optical system.
editor note: This class should better be defined in a more general device ontology or a domain ontology with the scope of optical devices.

label: spacially-offset setting datum
definition: An observation field setting datum that specifies in how far the detection of reflected or scattered light in an optical system is spatially-offset from the area of illumination.
editor note: This class should better be defined in a more general device ontology or a domain ontology with the scope of optical devices.

label: Stokes Raman Spectroscopy
definition: A Raman spectroscopy that has the objective to only detect and analyse Stokes Raman scattering.
equivalent class axiom: 'Raman spectroscopy' and achieves_planned_objective some 'Stokes Raman scattering assay objective'

label: anti-Stokes Raman Spectroscopy
definition: A Raman spectroscopy that has the objective to only detect and analyse anti-Stokes Raman scattering.
equivalent class axiom: 'Raman spectroscopy' and achieves_planned_objective some 'anti-Stokes Raman scattering assay objective'

label: Raman scattering
definition: A process of inelastic scattering of electromagnetic radiation, characterized by a loss or gain in energy of the incident photons corresponding to a vibrational, rotational or electronic energy transition within the scatterer.

label: Stokes Raman scattering
definition: A Raman scattering in which the scattered photon has lower energy than the incident photon.

label: anti-Stokes Raman scattering
definition: A Raman scattering in which the emitted photon has higher energy than the incident photon.

label: light polarization setting datum
definition: A setting datum that specifies the polarization of incident and/or detected light within an optical assay.
example of usage: The polarisation of the incident and scattered light was configured to be either parallel or perpendicular to each other. https://doi.org/10.1557%2Fs43579-021-00025-z

label: spectral window center
super class: setting datum|'is_specified_output_of' some 'center calculation data transformation'
definition: A setting datum that specifies the middle wavelength/wavenumber of a spectrum, equal to the average of the maximum and minimum of the spectral window range utilized during the acquisition of spectroscopic data. It corresponds to the optimal alignment or centering of the spectrometer to ensure that the most relevant spectral features are captured effectively within the defined acquisition range.
